channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Complete - River Rescue; INC#1406; 05:45PM; L.A. River south of Washington Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Tz7Np7; #BoyleHeights; An adult male suffering the effects of hypothermia (no other injuries yet determined) has been successfully rescued by an LAFD helicopter crew that hoisted him safely aboard their aircraft hovering above a corrugated concrete shear wall within the rain-swollen (undetermined water depth or speed) Los Angeles River south of Washington Blvd. He was provided in-flight medical care by the on-board LAFD Flight Paramedic team during his direct helicopter transport to the Los Angeles County - USC Medical Center. We have yet to confirm his age or the circumstances related to his being in the flood control channel. LAFD ground and air crews have systematically surveyed the area, and no other victims have been discovered.; FS 17; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; AO1 AO2 BC1 BC11 CM20 CM22 E14 E17 E203 E209 E9 EM1 H0B H0D H2 H3 H5 HA2 HA3 HA5 HR3 RA25 RA4 SC1 SW44 SW89 T3 T9 UR88 + LACoFD; CH5; 13 14; Brian Humphrey

River Rescue; INC#1406; 05:05PM; L.A. River x Washington Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Tz7Np7; #BoyleHeights; LAFD ground and air response to a person in distress in or near the rain-swollen Los Angeles River south of Washington Blvd.; FS 17; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 CM20 CM22 E14 E17 E203 E209 E9 EM1 H0B H0D H2 H3 H5 HA2 HA3 HA5 HR3 RA25 RA4 SC1 SW44 SW89 T3 T9 UR88; CH5; 13; Brian Humphrey

Update Multi-Patient Medical; INC#1030; 02:45PM; 7330 N Bakman Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/42jAR82; #SunValley; A total of eight persons (both boys and girls) ages 12-16, all conscious and breathing, have been medically evaluated by LAFD Paramedics at the scene for sudden illness that appears related to their ingestion of chewable marijuana ("gummies"). Five patients have been transported to area hospitals. Three have been released at the scene to parents. Though all eight patients were discovered upon the campus of Sun Valley Magnet School, a confirmation of how each may be affiliated with the campus remains a matter for LAUSD officials. LAFD Public Information Officer Firefighter David Ortiz is at the scene conducting media interviews.; FS 89; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; AP7 BC14 E289 E60 E77 E89 EM10 EM14 EM15 PI2 RA77 RA78 RA86 RA860 RA889 RA90 RA98 T89; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Multi-Patient Medical; INC#1030; 01:18PM; 7330 N Bakman Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/42jAR82; #SunValley; PRELIM: Multiple patients (all believed school aged), conscious and breathing, being evaluated for sudden illness at Sun Valley Magnet School after possible ingestion of chewable marijuana ("gummies"). At least seven patients have come forth (a final tally of patients will be offered at the conclusion of the incident). LAFD Public Information Officer Firefighter David Ortiz is en route, ETA 2:40 PM. Until his arrival, Media Inquiries should be directed to LAUSD officials.; FS 89; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; AP7 BC14 E289 E60 E77 E89 EM10 EM14 EM15 RA77 RA78 RA86 RA860 RA889 RA90 RA98 T89; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Trapped Vehicle; INC#0776; 12:59PM; Wb 10 Fy; MAP: https://bit.ly/3yERzku; Sawtelle; One vehicle on its side, down the embankment with one patient trapped. Firefighters stabilized the car with the two-line rope system and safely removed the patient from the vehicle. The 33yo male patient will be transported with non-life threatening injuries. LAFD Heavy Rescue will continue through to the incident to evaluate the vehicle whether it needs to be towed up or is at risk of falling further down the embankment. The 9-1-1 call was received at 12:37PM. No further details.; FS 92; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 11; BC18 E292 E58 E67 E71 EM18 HR3 RA59 RA92 T92; CH7; 12; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire - NOW OUT; INC#1546; 08:05PM; 556 N Oxford Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3JeAIdg; East Hollywood; Two story, center hall apartment building had smoke showing from one unit on the first floor. Firefighters initiated an offensive operation and located fire in one unit. 28 firefighters extinguished the fire in 15 minutes with no injuries reported. They are clearing the residual smoke from the hallway but the fire was prevented from extending beyond the unit of origin. Cause and $ loss TBD. The 9-1-1 call was received at 7:50PM. No further details. ; FS 52; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC5 E227 E229 E27 E52 E6 RA29 T27 T29; CH9; 13; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1475; 07:15PM; 13420 N Wheeler Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Z04tEB; Sylmar; KNOCKDOWN: 28 firefighters extinguished the fire in 18 minutes with no injuries reported. It was contained to a contents fire only and prevented from extending into the attic. Cause and $ loss TBD. No further details.; FS 91; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 E275 E298 E7 E75 E91 RA98 T75 T98; CH9; 17; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#1475; 06:57PM; 13420 N Wheeler Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Z04tEB; Sylmar; One story, single family dwelling (approximately 1300 sq ft) with moderate smoking showing from the attic upon LAFD arrival. Firefighters made entry and found excessive storage within the home. There is a contents fire which has possibly extended into the attic. Additional resources were requested (not reflected in this alert). Firefighters are in the offensive mode.; FS 91; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 E298 E75 E91 RA98 T98; CH9; 17; Margaret Stewart

Outside Fire; INC#0237; 06:26AM; 19337 W Ventura Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ZK8rCn; Tarzana; Firefighters are applying heavy streams to a large, outside fire (Synthetic Grass Depot) which is not threatening any structures. Due to the depth of the fire within the materials, LAFD Heavy Equipment is responding to assist in moving the pile so the water can effectively reach all pockets of fire. One firefighter is being transported for non-life threatening injury sustained when a civilian vehicle ran over a 4" supply line which knocked the firefighter to the ground. Due to the location of the nearest fire hydrant to an incident, it is sometimes necessary (we avoid it whenever possible) to cross streets with the large diameter supply line. This serves as a reminder to NEVER cross over a fire department hose line. Fortunately this was a minor injury but the potential for life-altering injuries is very real. The 9-1-1 call was received at 4:49AM. Firefighter will remain on scene through the morning working for a knockdown and continuing with the needed overhaul. Commuters are advised to avoid Ventura Blvd between Tampa Ave and Shirley Ave - please seek one of the many alternate routes. No further details.; FS 93; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC17 E273 E293 E83 E84 E93 EM15 EM17 HE2 RA93 T73 T93; CH8; 17; Margaret Stewart

Update Structure Fire; INC#0305; 09:34AM; 1825 Ocean Front Walk; MAP: https://bit.ly/3YHunwr; Venice; The business owner was in the building and heard a popping sound prior to the fire igniting. Cause of the fire is attributed to lithium-ion battery overheating. The pet dog of the business owner was sadly found deceased in the structure after fire extinguishment. Address updated from the initial alert (1 E 19th Av) No further details or updates anticipated. ; Margaret Stewart
